enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No destination bus error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a bus error on a destination write.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No source bus error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a bus error on a source read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No scatter/gather configuration error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No NBYTES/CITER configuration error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] = 0, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK].

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No destination offset configuration error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No destination address configuration error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No source offset configuration error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: No source address configuration error.

enumeratedValue.name: ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: The most-recently recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

register.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

field.name: MLOFF
field.description: If SMLOE = 1 or DMLOE = 1, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the DADDR

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is not applied to the SADDR

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The minor loop offset is applied to the SADDR

register.name: TCD0_CITER_ELINKNO
register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel-to-channel linking is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel-to-channel linking is enabled

register.name: TCD0_CITER_ELINKYES
register.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

field.name: ELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel-to-channel linking is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel-to-channel linking is enabled

register.name: TCD0_DLASTSGA
register.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

field.name: DLASTSGA
field.description: Destination last address adjustment, or next memory address TCD for channel (scatter/gather)

enumeratedValue.name: NO_START
enumeratedValue.description: Channel is not explicitly started

enumeratedValue.name: START
enumeratedValue.description: Channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request

field.name: INTMAJOR
field.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: End of major loop interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: End of major loop interrupt is enabled

field.name: INTHALF
field.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Half-point interrupt is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Half-point interrupt is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: NO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: The channel's ERQ field is not affected

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: The channel's ERQ field value changes to 0 when the major loop is complete

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format

enumeratedValue.name: SCATTER
enumeratedValue.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format

field.name: MAJORELINK
field.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel-to-channel linking is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Channel-to-channel linking is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No eDMA engine stalls

enumeratedValue.name: STALL4
enumeratedValue.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W

enumeratedValue.name: STALL8
enumeratedValue.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W

register.name: TCD0_BITER_ELINKNO

field.name: MGSTAT0
field.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

enumeratedValue.name: FPVIOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: No protection violation detected

enumeratedValue.name: FPVIOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Protection violation detected

enumeratedValue.name: ACCERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No access error detected

enumeratedValue.name: ACCERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Access error detected

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No collision error detected

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Collision error detected

enumeratedValue.name: CCIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: FTFE command in progress

enumeratedValue.name: CCIF_1
enumeratedValue.description: FTFE command has completed

enumeratedValue.name: EEERDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: See RAMRDY for availability of programming acceleration RAM

enumeratedValue.name: RAMRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: Programming acceleration RAM is not available

enumeratedValue.name: RAMRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: Programming acceleration RAM is available

field.name: PFLSH
field.description: This bit is reserved and always has the value 0.

enumeratedValue.name: SWAP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Program flash 0 block is located at relative address 0x0000

enumeratedValue.name: SWAP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Program flash 1 block is located at relative address 0x0000

enumeratedValue.name: ERSSUSP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No suspend requested

enumeratedValue.name: ERSSUSP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution

enumeratedValue.name: ERSAREQ_0
enumeratedValue.description: No request or request complete

enumeratedValue.name: ERSAREQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: Request to: 1) run the Erase All Blocks command, 2) verify the erased state, 3) program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and 4) release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLLIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Read collision error interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: RDCOLLIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever an FTFE read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).

enumeratedValue.name: CCIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Command complete interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: CCIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_0
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is secure

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_1
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is secure

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_2
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is unsecure (The standard shipping condition of the FTFE is unsecure.)

enumeratedValue.name: SEC_3
enumeratedValue.description: MCU security status is secure

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access granted

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access denied

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_2
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access denied

enumeratedValue.name: FSLACC_3
enumeratedValue.description: Factory access granted

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mass erase is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: MEEN_2

field.name: DFDIF
field.description: Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Flag

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault not detected during a valid flash read access from the platform flash controller

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIF_1

field.name: DFDIE
field.description: Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault detect interrupt disabled

enumeratedValue.name: DFDIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Double bit fault detect interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FERSTAT[DFDIF] flag is set.

enumeratedValue.name: FDFD_0
enumeratedValue.description: FERSTAT[DFDIF] sets only if a double bit fault is detected during read access from the platform flash controller

enumeratedValue.name: FDFD_1
enumeratedValue.description: FERSTAT[DFDIF] sets during any valid flash read access from the platform flash controller. An interrupt request is generated if the DFDIE bit is set.

enumeratedValue.name: COMP0_same_modcomb
enumeratedValue.description: If the channels (n) and (n+1) are in Combine Mode or Modified Combine PWM Mode, the channel (n+1) output is the same as the channel (n) output. enumeratedValue.name: COMP0_complement
enumeratedValue.description: The channel (n+1) output is the complement of the channel (n) output.

register.name: GENCS
register.description: TSI general control and status register

field.name: EOSDMEO
field.description: End-of-Scan DMA Transfer Request Enable Only

enumeratedValue.name: EOSDMEO_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not enable the End-of-Scan DMA transfer request only. Depending on ESOR state, either Out-of-Range or End-of-Scan can trigger a DMA transfer request and interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: EOSDMEO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Only the End-of-Scan event can trigger a DMA transfer request. The Out-of-Range event only and always triggers an interrupt if TSIIE is set.

enumeratedValue.name: EOSF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Scan not complete.

enumeratedValue.name: EOSF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Scan complete.

enumeratedValue.name: SCNIP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No scan in progress.

enumeratedValue.name: SCNIP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Scan in progress.

enumeratedValue.name: STM_0
enumeratedValue.description: Software trigger scan.

enumeratedValue.name: STM_1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware trigger scan.

enumeratedValue.name: STPE_0
enumeratedValue.description: TSI is disabled when MCU goes into low power mode.

enumeratedValue.name: STPE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Allows TSI to continue running in all low power modes.

enumeratedValue.name: TSIIEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: TSI interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TSIIEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: TSI interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TSIEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: TSI module disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TSIEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: TSI module enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DVOLT_1

enumeratedValue.name: DVOLT_2

enumeratedValue.name: DVOLT_3

enumeratedValue.name: ESOR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Out-of-range interrupt is allowed.

enumeratedValue.name: ESOR_1
enumeratedValue.description: End-of-scan interrupt is allowed.

enumeratedValue.name: SWTS_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: SWTS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Start a scan.

enumeratedValue.name: DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

enumeratedValue.description: Pin disabled (Alternative 0) (analog).

enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

enumeratedValue.name: DMA_BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_BOTH
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

enumeratedValue.name: INT_ONE
enumeratedValue.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

enumeratedValue.name: DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

enumeratedValue.name: DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

register.name: CS
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Control and Status Register

enumeratedValue.name: PWTOV_0
enumeratedValue.description: PWT counter no overflow.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTOV_1
enumeratedValue.description: PWT counter runs from 0xFFFF to 0x0000.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: PWT pulse width register(s) is not up-to-date.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: PWT pulse width register(s) has been updated.

field.name: FCTLE
field.description: First counter load enable after enable

enumeratedValue.name: FCTLE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not load the first counter values to corresponding registers

enumeratedValue.name: FCTLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Load the first coutner value to corresponding registers depended by the PWTIN level

enumeratedValue.name: PWTSR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No action taken.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTSR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Writing 1 to this field will perform soft reset to PWT.

enumeratedValue.name: POVIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

enumeratedValue.name: POVIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

field.name: PRDYIE
field.description: PWT Pulse Width Data Ready Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: PRDYIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

enumeratedValue.name: PRDYIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disables the PWT to generate interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enables the PWT to generate interrupt.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: The PWT is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PWTEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: The PWT is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 1.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 2.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_2
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 4.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_3
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 8.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_4
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 16.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_5
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 32.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_6
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 64.

enumeratedValue.name: PRE_7
enumeratedValue.description: Clock divided by 128.

field.name: TGL
field.description: PWTIN states Toggled from last state

enumeratedValue.name: TGL_0
enumeratedValue.description: The selected PWTIN hasn't changed its original states from last time.

enumeratedValue.name: TGL_1
enumeratedValue.description: The selected PWTIN has toggled its states.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[0] is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[1] is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_2
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[2] enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PINSEL_3
enumeratedValue.description: PWTIN[3] enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PCLKS_0
enumeratedValue.description: PWT_CLK is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

enumeratedValue.name: PCLKS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Alternative clock is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

register.name: PPH
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: High

register.name: PPL
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: Low

register.name: NPH
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: High

register.name: NPL
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: Low

register.name: CNTH
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: High

register.name: CNTL
register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: Low

enumeratedValue.name: standard
enumeratedValue.description: Standard features implemented.

enumeratedValue.name: state_logic_parallel
enumeratedValue.description: Supports state, logic, and parallel modes.

enumeratedValue.name: disable
enumeratedValue.description: FLEXIO module is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: enable
enumeratedValue.description: FLEXIO module is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: disable
enumeratedValue.description: Software reset is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: enable
enumeratedValue.description: Software reset is enabled. All FLEXIO registers except the Control Register are reset.

enumeratedValue.name: normal
enumeratedValue.description: Configures for normal register accesses to FLEXIO

enumeratedValue.name: fast
enumeratedValue.description: Configures for fast register accesses to FLEXIO

enumeratedValue.name: disable
enumeratedValue.description: FLEXIO is disabled in Debug modes.

enumeratedValue.name: emable
enumeratedValue.description: FLEXIO is enabled in Debug modes.

enumeratedValue.name: enable
enumeratedValue.description: FLEXIO enabled in Doze modes.

enumeratedValue.name: disable
enumeratedValue.description: FLEXIO disabled in Doze modes.

enumeratedValue.name: disable
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: receive
enumeratedValue.description: Receive mode. Captures the current shifter content into the SHIFTBUF on expiration of the timer.

enumeratedValue.name: transmit
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit mode. Load SHIFTBUF contents into the shifter on expiration of the timer.

enumeratedValue.name: matchstore
enumeratedValue.description: Match Store mode. Shifter data is compared to SHIFTBUF content on expiration of the timer.

enumeratedValue.name: matchcont
enumeratedValue.description: Match Continuous mode. Shifter data is continuously compared to SHIFTBUF contents.

enumeratedValue.name: active_high
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is active high

enumeratedValue.name: active_low
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is active low

enumeratedValue.name: disable
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin output disabled

enumeratedValue.name: opend_bidirouten
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin open-drain or bidirectional output enable

enumeratedValue.name: bidir_outdata
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin bidirectional output data

enumeratedValue.name: output
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter pin output

enumeratedValue.name: posedge
enumeratedValue.description: Shift on posedge of shift clock

enumeratedValue.name: negedge
enumeratedValue.description: Shift on negedge of shift clock

enumeratedValue.name: value00
enumeratedValue.description: Start bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store. Transmitter loads data on enable.

enumeratedValue.name: value01
enumeratedValue.description: Start bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store. Transmitter loads data on first shift.

enumeratedValue.name: value10
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs start bit value 0 before loading data on first shift. If start bit is not 0, receiver/match store sets error flag.

enumeratedValue.name: value11
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs start bit value 1 before loading data on first shift. If start bit is not 1, receiver/match store sets error flag.

enumeratedValue.name: value00
enumeratedValue.description: Stop bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store

enumeratedValue.name: value01
enumeratedValue.description: Stop bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store. When timer is in stop condition, receiver/match store stores receive data on the configured shift edge.

enumeratedValue.name: value10
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 0 on store. If stop bit is not 0, receiver/match store sets error flag. When timer is in stop condition, receiver/match stores also store receive data on the configured shift edge.

enumeratedValue.name: value11
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 1 on store. If stop bit is not 1, receiver/match store sets error flag. When timer is in stop condition, receiver/match store also stores receive data on the configured shift edge.

enumeratedValue.name: pin
enumeratedValue.description: Pin

enumeratedValue.name: shifter_nplus1
enumeratedValue.description: Shifter N+1 Output

enumeratedValue.name: ILT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

enumeratedValue.name: ILT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Idle line wakeup.

enumeratedValue.name: WAKE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Address mark wakeup.

enumeratedValue.name: M_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal-start + 8 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.

enumeratedValue.name: M_1
enumeratedValue.description: Use-start + 9 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.

enumeratedValue.name: RSRC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Selects internal loop back mode. The receiver input is internally connected to transmitter output.

enumeratedValue.name: RSRC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Single wire UART mode where the receiver input is connected to the transmit pin input signal.

enumeratedValue.name: UARTSWAI_0
enumeratedValue.description: UART clock continues to run in Wait mode.

enumeratedValue.name: UARTSWAI_1
enumeratedValue.description: UART clock freezes while CPU is in Wait mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. The receiver input is determined by RSRC.

enumeratedValue.name: SBK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal transmitter operation.

enumeratedValue.name: SBK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Queue break characters to be sent.

enumeratedValue.name: RWU_0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation.

enumeratedValue.name: RWU_1
enumeratedValue.description: RWU enables the wakeup function and inhibits further receiver interrupt requests. Normally, hardware wakes the receiver by automatically clearing RWU.

enumeratedValue.name: RE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver off.

enumeratedValue.name: RE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver on.

enumeratedValue.name: TE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter off.

enumeratedValue.name: TE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter on.

enumeratedValue.name: ILIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: IDLE interrupt requests disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ILIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: IDLE interrupt requests enabled.

field.name: RIE
field.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

enumeratedValue.name: RIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: RDRF interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: RDRF interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TCIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: TC interrupt requests disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TCIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: TC interrupt requests enabled.

field.name: TIE
field.description: Transmitter Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: TIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: TDRE interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: TDRE interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No parity error detected.

enumeratedValue.name: PF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Parity error.

enumeratedValue.name: FE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No framing error detected.

enumeratedValue.name: FE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Framing error.

enumeratedValue.name: NF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No noise detected.

enumeratedValue.name: NF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Noise detected in the received character in D.

enumeratedValue.name: OR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No overrun has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: OR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Overrun has occurred or the overrun flag has not been cleared since the last overrun occured.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver input is either active now or has never become active since the IDLE flag was last cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: IDLE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver input has become idle or the flag has not been cleared since it last asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: RDRF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data buffer is empty.

enumeratedValue.name: RDRF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data buffer is full.

enumeratedValue.name: TC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

enumeratedValue.name: TC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

enumeratedValue.name: TDRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data buffer is full.

enumeratedValue.name: TDRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data buffer is empty.

enumeratedValue.name: RAF_0
enumeratedValue.description: UART receiver idle/inactive waiting for a start bit.

enumeratedValue.name: RAF_1
enumeratedValue.description: UART receiver active, RxD input not idle.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character detection is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times if C1[M] = 0 or 12 bits time if C1[M] = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: BRK13_0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long.

enumeratedValue.name: BRK13_1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is 13 or 14 bits long.

enumeratedValue.name: RWUID_0
enumeratedValue.description: S1[IDLE] is not set upon detection of an idle character.

enumeratedValue.name: RWUID_1
enumeratedValue.description: S1[IDLE] is set upon detection of an idle character.

enumeratedValue.name: RXINV_0
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data is not inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: RXINV_1
enumeratedValue.description: Receive data is inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: MSBF_0
enumeratedValue.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

enumeratedValue.name: MSBF_1
enumeratedValue.description: MSB (bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit8, bit7, or bit6, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE].

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description: RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

enumeratedValue.name: RXEDGIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: RXEDGIF_1
enumeratedValue.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDIF_0
enumeratedValue.description: No LIN break character detected.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDIF_1
enumeratedValue.description: LIN break character detected.

enumeratedValue.name: PEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: PF interrupt requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: PEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: PF interrupt requests are enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: FE interrupt requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: FE interrupt requests are enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: NEIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: NF interrupt requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: NEIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: NF interrupt requests are enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ORIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: OR interrupts are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ORIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: OR interrupt requests are enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: TXINV_0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data is not inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: TXINV_1
enumeratedValue.description: Transmit data is inverted.

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

enumeratedValue.name: TXDIR_0
enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an input in single wire mode.

enumeratedValue.name: TXDIR_1
enumeratedValue.description: TXD pin is an output in single wire mode.

field.name: RT
field.description: Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data register and writes go to the write-only transmit data register

enumeratedValue.name: M10_0
enumeratedValue.description: The parity bit is the ninth bit in the serial transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: M10_1
enumeratedValue.description: The parity bit is the tenth bit in the serial transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: MAEN2_0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: MAEN2_1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If a match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.

enumeratedValue.name: MAEN1_0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: MAEN1_1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.

field.name: LBKDDMAS
field.description: LIN Break Detect DMA Select Bit

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDDMAS_0
enumeratedValue.description: If BDH[LBKDIE] and S2[LBKDIF] are set, the LBKDIF interrupt signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.

enumeratedValue.name: LBKDDMAS_1
enumeratedValue.description: If BDH[LBKDIE] and S2[LBKDIF] are set, the LBKDIF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: RDMAS_0
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDFR interrupt request signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.

enumeratedValue.name: RDMAS_1
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDRF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: TDMAS_0
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE interrupt request signal is asserted to request interrupt service.

enumeratedValue.name: TDMAS_1
enumeratedValue.description: If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.

peripheral.name: CMP0
peripheral.description: High-Speed Comparator (CMP), Voltage Reference (VREF) Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC), and Analog Mux (ANMUX)

field.name: HYSTCTR
field.description: Comparator hard block hysteresis control. See chip data sheet to get the actual hysteresis value with each level

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_0
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 0 hysteresis internally.

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_1
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 1 hysteresis internally.

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_2
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 2 hysteresis internally.

enumeratedValue.name: HYSTCTR_3
enumeratedValue.description: The hard block output has level 3 hysteresis internally.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Comparator hard block offset control. See chip data sheet to get the actual offset value with each level

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: The comparator hard block output has level 0 offset internally.

enumeratedValue.name: OFFSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: The comparator hard block output has level 1 offset internally.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Filter is disabled. If SE = 1, then COUT is a logic zero (this is not a legal state, and is not recommended). If SE = 0, COUT = COUTA.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 consecutive sample must agree (comparator output is simply sampled).

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_3
enumeratedValue.description: 3 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_5
enumeratedValue.description: 5 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_6
enumeratedValue.description: 6 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: FILTER_CNT_7
enumeratedValue.description: 7 consecutive samples must agree.

enumeratedValue.name: EN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Analog Comparator is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: EN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Analog Comparator is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: OPE_0
enumeratedValue.description: When OPE is 0, the comparator output (after window/filter settings dependent on software configuration) is not available to a packaged pin.

enumeratedValue.name: OPE_1
enumeratedValue.description: When OPE is 1, and if the software has configured the comparator to own a packaged pin, the comparator is available in a packaged pin.

enumeratedValue.name: COS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Set CMPO to equal COUT (filtered comparator output).

enumeratedValue.name: COS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Set CMPO to equal COUTA (unfiltered comparator output).

enumeratedValue.name: INVT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Does not invert the comparator output.

enumeratedValue.name: INVT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Inverts the comparator output.

enumeratedValue.name: PMODE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low Speed (LS) comparison mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: PMODE_1
enumeratedValue.description: High Speed (HS) comparison mode is selected, in VLPx mode, or Stop mode switched to Low Speed (LS) mode.

enumeratedValue.name: WE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Windowing mode is not selected.

enumeratedValue.name: WE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Windowing mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: SE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Sampling mode is not selected.

enumeratedValue.name: SE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Sampling mode is selected.

enumeratedValue.name: CFF_0
enumeratedValue.description: A falling edge has not been detected on COUT.

enumeratedValue.name: CFF_1
enumeratedValue.description: A falling edge on COUT has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: CFR_0
enumeratedValue.description: A rising edge has not been detected on COUT.

enumeratedValue.name: CFR_1
enumeratedValue.description: A rising edge on COUT has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: IEF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IEF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IER_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: IER_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMAEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DMAEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: IN0

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_2
enumeratedValue.description: IN2

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_3
enumeratedValue.description: IN3

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_4
enumeratedValue.description: IN4

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_5
enumeratedValue.description: IN5

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_6
enumeratedValue.description: IN6

enumeratedValue.name: MSEL_7
enumeratedValue.description: IN7

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: IN0

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_2
enumeratedValue.description: IN2

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_3
enumeratedValue.description: IN3

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_4
enumeratedValue.description: IN4

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_5
enumeratedValue.description: IN5

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_6
enumeratedValue.description: IN6

enumeratedValue.name: PSEL_7
enumeratedValue.description: IN7

enumeratedValue.name: VRSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Vin1 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

enumeratedValue.name: VRSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Vin2 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

enumeratedValue.name: DACEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: DAC is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DACEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: DAC is enabled.

field.name: INNSEL
field.description: Selection of the input to the negative port of the comparator

enumeratedValue.name: INNSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

enumeratedValue.name: INNSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

field.name: INPSEL
field.description: Selection of the input to the positive port of the comparator

enumeratedValue.name: INPSEL_0
enumeratedValue.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

enumeratedValue.name: INPSEL_1
enumeratedValue.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

field.name: ACOn
field.description: The result of the input comparison for channel n

field.name: INITMOD
field.description: Comparator and DAC initialization delay modulus.

enumeratedValue.name: INITMOD_0
enumeratedValue.description: The modulus is set to 64 (same with 111111).

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_0
enumeratedValue.description: The comparison result is sampled as soon as the active channel is scanned in one round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_1
enumeratedValue.description: The sampling takes place 1 round-robin clock cycle after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_2
enumeratedValue.description: The sampling takes place 2 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NSAM_3
enumeratedValue.description: The sampling takes place 3 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_0
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 0 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_1
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 1 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_2
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 2 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_3
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 3 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_4
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 4 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_5
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 5 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_6
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 6 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMXCH_7
enumeratedValue.description: Channel 7 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMP_0
enumeratedValue.description: The Plus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Minus port are swept in each round.

enumeratedValue.name: FXMP_1
enumeratedValue.description: The Minus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Plus port are swept in each round.

enumeratedValue.name: RRIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: The round-robin interrupt is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RRIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: The round-robin interrupt is enabled when a comparison result changes from the last sample.

enumeratedValue.name: RRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Round-robin operation is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: RRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Round-robin operation is enabled.

register.name: LVDSC1
register.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 1 Register

enumeratedValue.name: LVDRE_0
enumeratedValue.description: No system resets on low voltage detect events.

enumeratedValue.name: LVDRE_1
enumeratedValue.description: If the supply voltage falls below VLVD, a system reset will be generated.

enumeratedValue.name: LVDIE_0

enumeratedValue.name: LVDIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVDF = 1

enumeratedValue.name: LVDF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage event not detected

enumeratedValue.name: LVDF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage event detected

register.name: LVDSC2

enumeratedValue.name: LVWIE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

enumeratedValue.name: LVWIE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVWF=1

enumeratedValue.name: LVWF_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage warning event not detected

enumeratedValue.name: LVWF_1
enumeratedValue.description: Low-voltage warning event detected

enumeratedValue.name: BIASEN_0

enumeratedValue.name: BIASEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Biasing enabled, core logic is slower and there are restrictions in allowed system clock speed (see Data Sheet for details)

enumeratedValue.name: CLKBIASDIS_0

enumeratedValue.name: CLKBIASDIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: In VLPS mode, the bias currents and reference voltages for the following clock modules are disabled: SIRC, FIRC, PLL. (if available on device)

field.name: REGFPM

enumeratedValue.name: REGFPM_0
enumeratedValue.description: Regulator is in low power mode or transition to/from

enumeratedValue.name: REGFPM_1

enumeratedValue.name: LPOSTAT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low power oscillator in low phase

enumeratedValue.name: LPOSTAT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Low power oscillator in high phase

enumeratedValue.name: LPODIS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Low power oscillator enabled

enumeratedValue.name: LPODIS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Low power oscillator disabled

enumeratedValue.name: FEATURE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Standard features implemented

enumeratedValue.name: EHSRUN_0

enumeratedValue.name: EHSRUN_1

enumeratedValue.name: ELLS_0

enumeratedValue.name: ELLS_1
enumeratedValue.description: The feature is available.

enumeratedValue.name: ELLS2_0
enumeratedValue.description: The feature is not available.

enumeratedValue.name: ELLS2_1
enumeratedValue.description: The feature is available.

enumeratedValue.name: EVLLS0_0
enumeratedValue.description: The feature is not available.

enumeratedValue.name: EVLLS0_1
enumeratedValue.description: The feature is available.

enumeratedValue.name: AVLP_1

enumeratedValue.name: AHSRUN_0

enumeratedValue.name: AHSRUN_1
enumeratedValue.description: HSRUN is allowed

enumeratedValue.name: STOPM_2

enumeratedValue.name: STOPM_6

field.name: LVD
field.description: Low-Voltage Detect Reset or High-Voltage Detect Reset

enumeratedValue.name: LVD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by LVD trip, HVD trip or POR

enumeratedValue.name: LVD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by LVD trip, HVD trip or POR

enumeratedValue.name: LOC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by a loss of external clock.

enumeratedValue.name: LOC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by a loss of external clock.

enumeratedValue.name: LOL_0

enumeratedValue.name: LOL_1

enumeratedValue.name: WDOG_0

enumeratedValue.name: WDOG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by watchdog timeout

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by external reset pin

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_1

enumeratedValue.name: POR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by POR

enumeratedValue.name: POR_1

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKUP_0

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKUP_1

enumeratedValue.name: SW_0

enumeratedValue.name: SW_1

enumeratedValue.name: MDM_AP_1

enumeratedValue.name: SACKERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: SACKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

field.name: RSTFLTSRW
field.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

enumeratedValue.name: RSTFLTSRW_0
enumeratedValue.description: All filtering disabled

enumeratedValue.name: RSTFLTSRW_1
enumeratedValue.description: Bus clock filter enabled for normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: RSTFLTSRW_2
enumeratedValue.description: LPO clock filter enabled for normal operation

field.name: RSTFLTSS
field.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

enumeratedValue.name: RSTFLTSS_0
enumeratedValue.description: All filtering disabled

enumeratedValue.name: RSTFLTSS_1
enumeratedValue.description: LPO clock filter enabled

field.name: RSTFLTSEL
field.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

enumeratedValue.name: SLVD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by LVD trip or POR

enumeratedValue.name: SLVD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by LVD trip or POR

enumeratedValue.name: SLOC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by a loss of external clock.

enumeratedValue.name: SLOC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by a loss of external clock.

enumeratedValue.name: SLOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by a loss of lock in the PLL/FLL

enumeratedValue.name: SLOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by a loss of lock in the PLL/FLL

enumeratedValue.name: SWDOG_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by watchdog timeout

enumeratedValue.name: SWDOG_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by watchdog timeout

enumeratedValue.name: SPIN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by external reset pin

enumeratedValue.name: SPIN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by external reset pin

enumeratedValue.name: SPOR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by POR

enumeratedValue.name: SPOR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by POR

enumeratedValue.name: SLOCKUP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by core LOCKUP event

enumeratedValue.name: SLOCKUP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by core LOCKUP event

enumeratedValue.name: SSW_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

enumeratedValue.name: SSW_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

enumeratedValue.name: SMDM_AP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset was not caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

enumeratedValue.name: SMDM_AP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset was caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

enumeratedValue.name: SSACKERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: SSACKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: DELAY_3

enumeratedValue.name: LOC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LOL_0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: LOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: WDOG_0

enumeratedValue.name: WDOG_1

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_0

enumeratedValue.name: GIE_1

enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MDM_AP_1

enumeratedValue.name: SACKERR_1

field.name: VECTPENDING
field.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTCLR_0
enumeratedValue.description: no effect

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTCLR_1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSVCLR_0
enumeratedValue.description: no effect

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSVCLR_1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSVSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSVSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: NMIPENDSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: NMIPENDSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

enumeratedValue.name: SYSRESETREQ_0
enumeratedValue.description: no system reset request

enumeratedValue.name: SYSRESETREQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

enumeratedValue.name: ENDIANNESS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Little-endian

enumeratedValue.name: ENDIANNESS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Big-endian

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEPONEXIT_0
enumeratedValue.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEPONEXIT_1
enumeratedValue.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEPDEEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: sleep

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEPDEEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: deep sleep

enumeratedValue.name: SEVONPEND_0
enumeratedValue.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

enumeratedValue.name: SEVONPEND_1
enumeratedValue.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

field.name: UNALIGN_TRP
field.description: Always reads as one, indicates that all unaligned accesses generate a HardFault

field.name: STKALIGN
field.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

field.name: PRI_15
field.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

register.name: SHCSR
register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

enumeratedValue.name: SVCALLPENDED_0
enumeratedValue.description: exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: SVCALLPENDED_1
enumeratedValue.description: exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: HALTED_0
enumeratedValue.description: No active halt request debug event

enumeratedValue.name: HALTED_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halt request debug event active

enumeratedValue.name: BKPT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No current breakpoint debug event

enumeratedValue.name: BKPT_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

enumeratedValue.name: DWTTRAP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT

enumeratedValue.name: DWTTRAP_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

enumeratedValue.name: VCATCH_0
enumeratedValue.description: No Vector catch triggered

enumeratedValue.name: VCATCH_1
enumeratedValue.description: Vector catch triggered

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL_0
enumeratedValue.description: No EDBGRQ debug event

enumeratedValue.name: EXTERNAL_1
enumeratedValue.description: EDBGRQ debug event

register.name: DHCSR_Read
register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

field.name: C_DEBUGEN
field.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE. This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control. This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled

field.name: C_HALT
field.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halt the processor.

field.name: C_STEP
field.description: Processor step bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Step the processor.

field.name: C_MASKINTS
field.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both: - before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1. - the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit. This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit. The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not mask.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

field.name: S_REGRDY
field.description: S_REGRDY bit. A handshake flag for transfers through the DCRDR: - Writing to DCRSR clears the bit to 0. - Completion of the DCRDR transfer then sets the bit to 1. This bit is valid only when the processor is in Debug state, otherwise the bit is UNKNOWN.

enumeratedValue.name: S_REGRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: There has been a write to the DCRDR, but the transfer is not complete.

enumeratedValue.name: S_REGRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: The transfer to or from the DCRDR is complete.

field.name: S_HALT
field.description: S_HALT bit. Indicates whether the processor is in Debug state.

enumeratedValue.name: S_HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Not in Debug state.

enumeratedValue.name: S_HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: In Debug state.

field.name: S_SLEEP
field.description: S_SLEEP bit. Indicates whether the processor is sleeping. The debugger must set the C_HALT bit to 1 to gain control, or wait for an interrupt or other wakeup event to wakeup the system.

enumeratedValue.name: S_SLEEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Not sleeping.

enumeratedValue.name: S_SLEEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Sleeping.

field.name: S_LOCKUP
field.description: S_LOCKUP bit. Indicates whether the processor is locked up because of an unrecoverable exception. This bit can only be read as 1 by a remote debugger, using the DAP. The value of 1 indicates that the processor is running but locked up. The bit clears to 0 when the processor enters Debug state.

enumeratedValue.name: S_LOCKUP_0
enumeratedValue.description: Not locked up

enumeratedValue.name: S_LOCKUP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Locked up

field.name: S_RETIRE_ST
field.description: S_RETIRE_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has completed the execution of an instruction since the last read of DHCSR. This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR. A debugger can check this bit to determine if the processor is stalled on a load, store or fetch access. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on or Local reset, but then is set to 1 as soon as the processor executes and retires an instruction.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RETIRE_ST_0
enumeratedValue.description: No instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RETIRE_ST_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

field.name: S_RESET_ST
field.description: S_RESET_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has been reset since the last read of DHCSR. This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RESET_ST_0
enumeratedValue.description: No reset since last DHCSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: S_RESET_ST_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one reset since last DHCSR read.

register.name: DHCSR_Write
register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

field.name: C_DEBUGEN
field.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE. This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control. This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: C_DEBUGEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled

field.name: C_HALT
field.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_HALT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halt the processor.

field.name: C_STEP
field.description: Processor step bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: C_STEP_1
enumeratedValue.description: Step the processor.

field.name: C_MASKINTS
field.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both: - before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1. - the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit. This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit. The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not mask.

enumeratedValue.name: C_MASKINTS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

field.name: DBGKEY
field.description: Debug key: Software must write 0xA05F to this field to enable write accesses to bits [15:0], otherwise the processor ignores the write access.

field.name: REGSEL
field.description: REGSEL bits. Specifies the ARM core register, special-purpose register, or Floating-point extension register, to transfer.

field.name: REGWnR
field.description: REGWnR bit. Specifies the access type for the transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: REGWnR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Read

enumeratedValue.name: REGWnR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Write

field.name: DBGTMP
field.description: DBGTMP bits. Data temporary cache, for reading and writing the ARM core registers, special-purpose registers, and Floating-point extension registers. The value of this register is UNKNOWN: - on reset - if the processor is in Debug state, the debugger has written to DCRSR since entering Debug state and DHCSR.S_REGRDY is set to 0.

register.name: DEMCR
register.description: Debug Exception and Monitor Control Register

field.name: VC_CORERESET
field.description: VC_CORERESET bit. Enable Reset Vector Catch. This causes a Local reset to halt a running system. If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_CORERESET_0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset Vector Catch disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_CORERESET_1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset Vector Catch enabled.

field.name: VC_HARDERR
field.description: VC_HARDERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a HardFault exception. If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_HARDERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: VC_HARDERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

field.name: DWTENA
field.description: DWTENA bit. Global enable for all features configured and controlled by the DWT unit.

enumeratedValue.name: DWTENA_0
enumeratedValue.description: DWT disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DWTENA_1
enumeratedValue.description: DWT enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_4
enumeratedValue.description: Instruction fetch.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_5
enumeratedValue.description: Data operand read.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_6
enumeratedValue.description: Data operand write.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_7
enumeratedValue.description: Data operand (read + write).

enumeratedValue.name: DATAVMATCH_0
enumeratedValue.description: Perform address comparison.

enumeratedValue.name: DATAVMATCH_1
enumeratedValue.description: Perform data value comparison.

enumeratedValue.name: DATAVSIZE_0
enumeratedValue.description: Byte.

enumeratedValue.name: DATAVSIZE_1
enumeratedValue.description: Halfword.

enumeratedValue.name: DATAVSIZE_2
enumeratedValue.description: Word.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCHED_0
enumeratedValue.description: No match.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCHED_1
enumeratedValue.description: Match occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_4
enumeratedValue.description: Instruction fetch.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_5
enumeratedValue.description: Data operand read.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_6
enumeratedValue.description: Data operand write.

enumeratedValue.name: FUNCTION_7
enumeratedValue.description: Data operand (read + write).

enumeratedValue.name: MATCHED_0
enumeratedValue.description: No match.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCHED_1
enumeratedValue.description: Match occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: ACOMP0_0
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger TSTOP based on the assertion of FCT0[MATCHED].

enumeratedValue.name: ACOMP0_1
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger TSTART based on the assertion of FCT0[MATCHED].

enumeratedValue.name: ACOMP1_0
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger TSTOP based on the assertion of FCT1[MATCHED].

enumeratedValue.name: ACOMP1_1
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger TSTART based on the assertion of FCT1[MATCHED].

field.name: ASC
field.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

enumeratedValue.name: ASC_0
enumeratedValue.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is absent.

enumeratedValue.name: ASC_1
enumeratedValue.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present.

field.name: AMC
field.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

enumeratedValue.name: AMC_0
enumeratedValue.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is absent

enumeratedValue.name: AMC_1
enumeratedValue.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present

enumeratedValue.name: ARB_0
enumeratedValue.description: Fixed-priority arbitration for the crossbar masters

enumeratedValue.name: ARB_1
enumeratedValue.description: Round-robin arbitration for the crossbar masters

enumeratedValue.name: DFCDA_0
enumeratedValue.description: Enable flash controller data caching

enumeratedValue.name: DFCDA_1
enumeratedValue.description: Disable flash controller data caching.

enumeratedValue.name: DFCIC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Enable flash controller instruction caching.

enumeratedValue.name: DFCIC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Disable flash controller instruction caching.

enumeratedValue.name: DFCC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Enable flash controller cache.

enumeratedValue.name: DFCC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Disable flash controller cache.

enumeratedValue.name: EFDS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable flash data speculation.

enumeratedValue.name: EFDS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable flash data speculation.

enumeratedValue.name: DFCS_0
enumeratedValue.description: Enable flash controller speculation.

enumeratedValue.name: DFCS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Disable flash controller speculation.

enumeratedValue.name: ESFC_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.

enumeratedValue.name: ESFC_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.

enumeratedValue.name: CPOREQ_0
enumeratedValue.description: Request is cleared.

enumeratedValue.name: CPOREQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: Request Compute Operation.

enumeratedValue.name: CPOACK_0
enumeratedValue.description: Compute operation entry has not completed or compute operation exit has completed.

enumeratedValue.name: CPOACK_1
enumeratedValue.description: Compute operation entry has completed or compute operation exit has not completed.

enumeratedValue.name: CPOWOI_0
enumeratedValue.description: No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: CPOWOI_1
enumeratedValue.description: When set, the CPOREQ is cleared on any interrupt or exception vector fetch.

enumeratedValue.name: PDO_0
enumeratedValue.description: Logic level 0 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.

enumeratedValue.name: PDO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Logic level 1 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.

enumeratedValue.name: PTSO_0
enumeratedValue.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.

enumeratedValue.name: PTSO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn is set to logic 1.

enumeratedValue.name: PTCO_0
enumeratedValue.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.

enumeratedValue.name: PTCO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn is cleared to logic 0.

enumeratedValue.name: PTTO_0
enumeratedValue.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.

enumeratedValue.name: PTTO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn is set to the inverse of its existing logic state.

enumeratedValue.name: PDI_0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin logic level is logic 0, or is not configured for use by digital function.

enumeratedValue.name: PDI_1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin logic level is logic 1.

enumeratedValue.name: PDD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is configured as general-purpose input, for the GPIO function. The pin will be high-Z if the port input is disabled in FPIOx_PIDR register.

enumeratedValue.name: PDD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin is configured as general-purpose output, for the GPIO function.

enumeratedValue.description: Logic level 0 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.
